revised_title: X-ray Absorption Spectroscopy Study of Amorphous Calcium Carbonate in Cystoliths
tldr: Researchers studied the structure and transformation of amorphous calcium carbonate in plant cystoliths using X-ray absorption spectroscopy. They found that the production and maintenance of the amorphous phase is under biological control and may play a role in pH regulation and metal ion sequestration in plants. The study provides insights into the structure and properties of amorphous biominerals.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
